intro: Oldenlandia evenia, commonly known as the silverleaf false spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, white or pale blue flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
